item.description:
The forest display changes rapidly at this time of the year; catch the spring extravaganza in full swing at the end of May: carpets of birdfoot violets, flowering huckleberries, bayberry catkins, bright blooms of creeping cherry, and more.
The start/end point and duration is going to be the same as during the April 23 walk, the parking lot (Parking Lot 2—see the MSSF Map in "Files") at the intersection of Three-Cornered Pond Rd. and Upper College Pond Rd., though the route will be different. Be prepared to make a 3-mile loop with frequent stops. Duration: at least 3 hrs. (maybe even more). Kids age 9+ are welcome. Friendly dogs are OK. Don't forget to pack water and a snack.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for Irina at Parking Lot 2
item.why: We will enjoy viewing the changes spring brings!

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Spring Plant Walk in MSSF with Irina Kadis
